Duffy depicts the 1st Amendment as a one-way pass for him to officially elevate symbols of his Christian faith in a public hearing room with no consideration for other faith perspectives – “we have freedom of religion, not freedom from religion.” He is wrong. The Establishment Clause prohibits government favoring or endorsing any religion.
